title: Downtown Block Party: BackFire
description: A free concert in your downtown on East College Avenue!

title: Quarterly Ambassador Meeting
description: Ambassadors serve an important role for the chamber. They go into the community and forge relationships that strengthen the business community as a whole. At the quarterly meetings, Ambassadors choose members they would like to contact, update chamber staff on the activities of the membership, and network with each other.

title: Hartsville Farmers Market
description: Let's Get Fresh! Vegetables! Your Hartsville Farmers Market is on the 2nd Saturday of each month from April through December.

title: Bottles and Brushes
description: Bottles and Brushes, Fun Art not Fine Art When: 2nd and 4th Thursday of every month Time: 6:00pm - 8:00pm Cost: $35 includes materials Join Jenny Altman with Art Bug Studio at BCAC for a social painting class with easy step by step instructions for completing a painting in one session. Creative fun for all levels, even the complete novice who has never held a paint brush. Bring your own beverage. Call 843.250.4592 to register, must be registered by 10…

title: Centennial Farmers Market
description: Let’s Get Fresh! Vegetables! The Centennial Farmers Market is downtown every Thursday from 3-6pm.

title: Downtown Block Party: The Tim Clark Band
description: A free concert in your downtown on East College Avenue!

title: Jacob Bryant live at Mac’s/ Justin Anderson Benefit show
description: At 26, Jacob Bryant has lived through more than men twice his age. Hidden behind his blue eyes and charming smile lies a past of addiction, death, and divorce that have fueled his songwriting and pushed him to track some of his most popular biographical anthems including "Save My Soul," "This Side of Sober," "Too Late to Turn Around," "Country Went to Hell," and "Up In Flames." The Jasper, Ga., native performs with the vigor of a seasoned road dog…

title: 2017 Connections at Breakfast-Carolina Pines Regional Medical Center
description: Connections events are held monthly from 5:30 to 7:00 p.m. Chamber members host these events in their place of business so they can promote their products/services. Business cards are also collected from those in attendance and given to the host at the end of the evening. Members who attend have an opportunity to be drawn to give a 60-second infomercial about their business.

title: Centennial Farmers Market
description: Let’s Get Fresh! Vegetables! The Centennial Farmers Market is downtown every Thursday from 3-6pm.

title: Black Glass Invades Mac’s
description: The ultimate arena rock experience returns to Mac's. Founded in 2005, Black Glass covers all the 80's hits no other band dares.

title: SHIFT | MINDSET
description: What's holding you back? Part 2 of SHIFT 2017 the quarterly Networking and Personal development Seminar We opened 2017 with Possibilities, Empowerment and possibilities of the new year and provided 6 Dynamic message's from a diverse range of experts. This time we are focusing on the Mindset. What's holding you back? Join us for a discussion about a Growth Vs Fixed mindset. Challenging, Meaningful, Significant Conversation Capacity is limited at 100, so sign your friends up too. Register now http://www.tregammage.com/event/shift-mindset/…

title: 2017 Walk With the Docs
description: This year, "Walk with the Docs" wil be held on April 23, at 10:00 AM at the Darlington Racetrack! Joining the two annual walks into one at the Racetrack gives the Free Medical Clinic of Darlington County a chance to come together as supporters of a ministry that covers our entire county.

title: Downtown Block Party: The Paul Grimshaw Band
description: A free concert in your downtown on East College Avenue!

title: Doug McCormick’s Hometown Show
description: Doug McCormick with Special Guest Justin Anderson.

title: Walk With The Docs 2017
description: Register now for the 12th Annual “Walk with the Docs” on Saturday, April 29th. Check in at Davidson Hall on Coker College’s Campus at 9:00 AM with games, inflatables, vendors, and music before the Walk begins. At 10 AM we will begin walking through town and local neighborhoods in honor of area physicians, pharmacists, and nurses. The Walk will be 3 miles long and the funds will be raised for the Free Medical Clinic of Darlington County. Every walker will…

title: Autism Awareness F.A.I.R.
description: This is an Autism Awareness Event because April is National Autism Awareness Month around the world! This is a F.A.I.R. which stands for Fun, Awareness, Information, Recreation. Darlington County Autism Support Group want to help increase understanding and acceptance of autism spectrum disorder of how it affects the individual and their families throughout communities. We will have information on the autism spectrum disorder, door prizes, $5 Raffle (Clemson and Gamecock Basket), bouncy house, Manicures, face painting, organizations that help families…

title: Evening Under the Oaks
description: The popular Spring affair that's back for a second year! Join us for a beautiful spring evening of fine food, spirits and friends to benefit the Darlington County Humane Society. Evening Under the Oaks will feature a wide variety of food stations along with signature cocktails and a unique live auction. Dress: Southern Cocktail Lawn Party

title: Centennial Farmers Market
description: Let’s Get Fresh! Vegetables! The Centennial Farmers Market is downtown every Thursday from 3-6pm.

title: 2017 Taste of Hartsville presented by Embrace Hospice
description: The Taste of Hartsville presented by Embrace Hospice will be held at the Hartsville Country Club. Dress up and be ready to enjoy mouthwatering delights prepared by local chefs and cooks in celebration of the area's finest cuisine and beverages. This year, the chamber has partnered with Black Creek Arts Council and Kalmia Gardens to make the event even more special by revealing the winners of the Plein Air contest that night. Participants will enjoy listening to smooth musical sounds,…

title: Susto with special guest Becca Mancari
description: Justin Osborne needed a break. He'd been writing music and making albums since he was 15, and by the age of 26, he felt like he was spinning his wheels. He knew he needed a change, so he ended his old band Sequoyah Prep School and moved to Cuba. He thought he might be done with music for a while, but the songs just kept coming. "I had this idea in my mind that I was going to try and…

title: James and the Giant Peach
description: Presented by Columbia Children's Theatre Sponsored by Duke Energy Foundation A delightfully off beat adaptation of the classic Roald Dahl adventure! When James is sent by his conniving aunts to chop down their old fruit tree, he discovers a magic potion that results in a tremendous peach and launches a journey of enormous proportions. Suddenly, James finds himself in the center of the gigantic peach among human-sized insects with equally oversized personalities but, after it falls from the tree and…

title: James and the Giant Peach
description: Presented by Columbia Children's Theatre Sponsored by Duke Energy Foundation A delightfully off beat adaptation of the classic Roald Dahl adventure! When James is sent by his conniving aunts to chop down their old fruit tree, he discovers a magic potion that results in a tremendous peach… and launches a journey of enormous proportions. Suddenly, James finds himself in the center of the gigantic peach – among human-sized insects with equally oversized personalities – but, after it falls from the…

title: Vila*Nova
description: Villa*Nova tns rock guy 'n' roll upside down. HailingVilla*NovVilla*Nova turns rock 'n' roll upside down. Hailing Columbia, SC, the band distills elements of funky pop and rock into a hypnotic hybrid. Villa*Nova prides itself on making music with solid grooves and soulful, dynamic lyrics provided by lead vocalist/guitarist/song writer BC Villa*Nova, fluid and funky bass lines by Bobby Dredd bombastic fantastic, rock solid drummer (and backing vocals) Young Sean, amazing harmony vocals and rhythm guitar by Brandon Hooker, and turntable…

title: Blue Dogs with Trey Davis
description: Hedquartered in Charleston during the 1990s and 2000s, the Blue Dogs built a solid reputation as one of the most popular bands in South Carolina's Americana scene. Led by Bobby Houck and Hank Futch, the combo has specialized in a guitar-based, acoustic-leaning, highly melodic blend of traditional country, classic rock, folk-pop and bluegrass. With drummer Greg Walker and a rotation of musical colleagues, Houck and Futch regularly front the Blue Dogs on stage around Charleston and the Southeast, performing at…

title: Women’s Leadership Symposium
description: For the first time, the chamber will be hosting a Women's Leadership Symposium. Thee symposium will be a day filled with empowering development opportunities for professional women. During the event, a tuition reimbusment scholarship will be awarded to two students, one from Coker College and one from Florence-Darlington Technical College. The 2017 Woman of Achievement will also be recognized at this event. As this event is still in the planning stages, look for more information to come.
